H0.text: Air is needed to change ice into water.

H1.text: Energy is needed to change ice into water.

H2.text: Stirring is needed to change ice into water.

H3.text: Chemicals are needed to change ice into water.

A4.text: The enthalpy of fusion is the amount of energy required to convert one mole of solid into liquid.

A5.text: The liquid phase has a higher internal energy than the solid phase. This means energy must be supplied to a solid in order to melt it.
